subject: RE: Eugene PD x Flock - procurement next steps
body:
Hi Caroline,

 

Thanks for checking in, the last round of changes are still in review with our Purchasing team at the moment, I�m hoping to have their guidance back within this work week if all goes well. Thanks for staying in touch.

 

Best,

 

Tim Costin

Sr. Financial Analyst

Eugene Police Department

300 Country Club Road

Eugene, Oregon 97401

Office: (541) 682-8364

Cell: (541) 844-9015

 



 

From: Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com> 
Sent: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 4:56 PM
To: COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov>
Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov>; CHOTERUNGRUANGKORN Nikki <NChoterungruangkorn@eugene-or.gov>
Subject: Re: Eugene PD x Flock - procurement next steps

 

[EXTERNAL ?]

Hi Tim,

 

Wanted to check on the review of Flock's comments. Any updates? Thanks!

	On Fri, Feb 14, 2025 at 4:58?PM COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov TCostin@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

		Good afternoon Caroline,

		 

		We have reviewed the proposed edits from Flock and provided redline responses in the attached contract draft documents for your legal team to review. Please see the attached documents.

		 

		To summarize the feedback we received broadly, the City Attorney advised that the Flock MSA remain as an attachment instead of being integrated directly in the City agreement language. Certain sections of the MSA, including payments terms from 6.1 and termination relating to Hardware in 7.2 were integrated directly since they corresponded with sections in the City�s agreement.

		 

		Additional changes:

		*	Section 4: Compensation � Proposed language to integrate compensation language from City/Flock agreements
		*	The City cannot accept the request for lower insurance thresholds, as our requirements are driven by the Oregon Tort Act, vendors generally use an Umbrella policy to bridge any coverage gaps
		*	FLOCK  MSA to be added as Exhibit D, not directly integrated into City Agreement language
		*	Exhibit B Scope � still waiting on final scope of work to be agreed upon between Flock/EPD
		*	Exhibit C Compensation Schedule � awaiting final quote/scope
		*	Missing info:

			*	Flock Safety entity type, and State of incorporation (page 1)
			*	Key Personnel to list from Flock Safety � ie project implementation, etc (page 2)
			*	Contractual Point of Contact for Flock Safety (page 10)
			*	Final Scope & Quote

		 

		If you have any questions, please don�t hesitate to reach out. As we draw closer to having an Agreement that works for both parties, or if we get hung up anywhere, the City�s Attorney has offered to meet with Flock�s legal team if any points need to be discussed more in depth.

		 

		Best regards,

		 

		Tim Costin

		Sr. Financial Analyst

		Eugene Police Department

		300 Country Club Road

		Eugene, Oregon 97401

		Office: (541) 682-8364

		Cell: (541) 844-9015



		From: Caroline Fraher <caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com caroline.fraher@flocksafety.com > 
		Sent: Thursday, February 6, 2025 5:24 PM
		To: COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov TCostin@eugene-or.gov >
		Cc: BURKE Jacob T <JBurke@eugene-or.gov JBurke@eugene-or.gov >; CHOTERUNGRUANGKORN Nikki <NChoterungruangkorn@eugene-or.gov NChoterungruangkorn@eugene-or.gov >
		Subject: Re: Eugene PD x Flock - procurement next steps

		 

		[EXTERNAL ?]

		Hi Tim,

		 

		Wanted to check in and see if your legal team is still working through the contract review?

	
 

Caroline Fraher
Regional Account Executive II

Caroline Fraher

				On Fri, Jan 24, 2025 at 9:33?AM COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov TCostin@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

					Good morning Caroline,

					 

					Thank you for sending over Flock�s legal docs for review, we will run these through our Attorney. Please see the attached draft agreement which includes the City of Eugene�s standard agreement and terms for the purchase of software services. Please note Exhibit A includes the City�s Standard Contract Provision and any proposed edits to that section would require attorney approval. 

					 

					We utilize a similar process, so please include proposed edits via Microsoft Word Track Changes.

					 

					If you have any questions during review, please reach out to me and I�ll connect you with the right party to answer the questions. I have included my colleague Nikki Choterungruangkorn as well, who supports our team with contract administration. 

					 

					Best,

					 

					Tim Costin

					Sr. Financial Analyst

					Eugene Police Department

					300 Country Club Ro

thread_messages.body:
Hi Caroline,

 

Thanks for checking in, the last round of changes are still in review with our Purchasing team at the moment, I�m hoping to have their guidance back within this work week if all goes well. Thanks for staying in touch.

 

Best,

 

Tim Costin

Sr. Financial Analyst

Eugene Police Department

300 Country Club Road

Eugene, Oregon 97401

Office: (541) 682-8364

Cell: (541) 844-9015

				On Fri, Jan 24, 2025 at 9:33?AM COSTIN Timothy M <TCostin@eugene-or.gov TCostin@eugene-or.gov > wrote:

					Good morning Caroline,

					 

					Thank you for sending over Flock�s legal docs for review, we will run these through our Attorney. Please see the attached draft agreement which includes the City of Eugene�s standard agreement and terms for the purchase of software services. Please note Exhibit A includes the City�s Standard Contract Provision and any proposed edits to that section would require attorney approval. 

					 

					We utilize a similar process, so please include proposed edits via Microsoft Word Track Changes.

					 

					If you have any questions during review, please reach out to me and I�ll connect you with the right party to answer the questions. I have included my colleague Nikki Choterungruangkorn as well, who supports our team with contract administration. 

					 

					Best,

					 

					Tim Costin

					Sr. Financial Analyst

					Eugene Police Department

					300 Country Club Ro
